definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]

sentences.english: The little boy fell headlong down the flight of stairs.
sentences.chinese: 那小男孩头朝下跌下楼梯。

sentences.english: Decreased overall still in channels, short-short pattern is unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 总体仍处于下跌通道中，短期空头格局不变。

sentences.english: The price of sugar will drop soon.
Wall Street gains after a smaller-than-expected number of jobs lost and a surprise drop in the unemployment rate.
sentences.chinese: 小于预期的失业数和失业率的神奇下跌使美股上涨。

sentences.english: The price of potash has already started to recover from declines sparked by the Great Recession.
sentences.chinese: 碳酸钾价格已经从大萧条造成的下跌中回升了。

sentences.english: A short seller bets that a stock price will fall.
sentences.chinese: 有一个空头押注该公司股票价格将下跌。

sentences.english: By March 3, the average fare had dropped 8% to $312.
sentences.chinese: 到3月3日，均价下跌了8%，跌至312美元。

sentences.english: The dollar declined on the open market.
sentences.chinese: 美元在公开市场上下跌了。

sentences.english: Even so, other reports showed big drops in housing sales in May. That followed the end of a homebuyer's tax credit.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，其他报告显示五月房价大幅度下跌。

sentences.english: And non-Apple smartphone prices continue to fall.
sentences.chinese: 非苹果品牌的智能手机价格继续下跌。

sentences.english: European Inter-bank lending rates fell after the ECB's press conference.
sentences.chinese: 央行新闻发布会召开之后欧洲银行间拆借利率下跌。

sentences.english: All 30 stocks in the Dow Jones industrial average fell. The index closed down 279.65 points, or 2.22 percent, at 12,290.14.
sentences.chinese: 道琼斯工业平均指数的30只股票全线下跌。

sentences.english: The stockmarket has fallen by nearly 80% this year. Ukraine’s inflation is an alarming 25%.
"The tea leaves that are falling—as sparse as they are—are falling on the negative side, " said Jim Meyer, chief investment officer at Tower Bridge Advisors.
sentences.chinese: 正如茶叶本身的稀少的一样，茶叶正下跌为负数。

sentences.english: A falling New Zealand dollar may not placate producers.
sentences.chinese: 新西兰元的下跌也不会令奶农感到欣慰。

sentences.english: Prices may be down but the risks have also grown.
sentences.chinese: 房价虽然下跌，但购房风险同时也增大了。

definition: to fall back (of water level or share prices)
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
to continue to fall (of share prices)
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
